Description: 'Vue des temples de l'isle de Philae', one of four studies of Philae for Plate 72 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; a near view of the temple ruins on the island, figures in a boat at left and others climbing steps Pen and grey ink, grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Louis Pierre Baltard for Denon's 'Voyage...' (there is no copy of the book the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12). The island on which the temple complex stands was submerged after the construction of the Aswan Lower Dam and the buildings were later moved to another island nearby so keep them above the level of the Nile. Lit.: P. Rosenberg (ed.), exhib. cat., Paris, Musée du Louvre, 'Dominique-Vivant Denon: l'oeil de Napoléon', 1999, no. 112
Bibliographic references: Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (p.88)
Exhibition history: 1999/2000 Oct-Jan, Paris, Musée du Louvre, Denon 1747-1825 2015/16 Oct-Feb, British Museum, Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
